facts.1: St. Swithun's Day is a day on which people watch the weather for tradition says that whatever the weather is like on St. Swithun's Day, it will continue so for the next forty days.
facts.2: St. Swithun was an Anglo-Saxon bishop of Winchester who died in 862 AD.
facts.3: Legend states that St. Swithun requested to be buried outside where his grave could be rained on and passed over by the steps of common men.

facts.1: Sea Sunday is celebrated by Christian churches to remember and pray for seafarers and their families and to give thanks for their lives and work.
facts.2: It is recognized by the International Maritime Organization and supported by many different denominations including Anglican, Roman Catholic, Baptist, and Methodist.
facts.3: The Mission to Seafarers, Sailors' Society, and other maritime welfare organizations support seafarers by providing services like practical assistance, welfare support, and a friend that seafarers can talk to.

facts.1: The Bon Festival, also known as Obon, is a Japanese Buddhist custom to honor the spirits of one's ancestors.
facts.2: Bon Festival typically lasts for three days and many Japanese people return to their hometowns to visit the graves of their departed relatives.
facts.3: Traditional activities during Bon include Bon Odori, a dance performed during the festival, and the floating of lanterns on water to guide the spirits back to the world of the dead.
